results.title: Inspecting the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “How to Drive”.
Good driving depends on good habits and a quick daily inspection as well as regular maintenance of those items which directly affect safety is the first good habit to develop. Demonstrates a quick and easy method of checking items, by starting at the driver’s door and walking anti-clockwise around the car.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Cornering and overtaking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates by high angle photography, graphics and animation how certain forces are set in motion when we change direction in a car. Safe methods of cornering, positioning and overtaking are shown, and points of courtesy and common sense in each case are noted.

results.title: Moving off on hills, reversing and parking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “How to Drive”.
Having gained experience in the fundamentals of car control, the learner is now ready to acquire the skills required to complete those driving manoeuvres in which co-ordination of control movements plays an important part: the hill start, reversing and parking.

results.title: Starting up, moving off and stopping
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “How to Drive”.
Safe driving techniques begin even before the engine is started. Demonstrates good habits to acquire on entering the car: checking the driving position, the seat belt and all-round visibility. The procedures involved in starting, moving off and stopping are shown; confidence and ability can now be gained by practice.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: In dense traffic
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “How to Drive”.
Town driving demands great powers of concentration, road observation, the ability to react quickly to changing situations, and considerable driving skill. Patience and restraint play an important part in dense traffic driving, allowing safe distance around our vehicle as a ‘cushion of air’ and giving greater visibility of traffic movement ahead.

results.title: Steering, gear changing and braking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “How to Drive”.
Having got the feel of the car by practising starting and moving off procedures, the driver is now ready to increase speed. To attain this, demonstrates a system of steering, together with gear changing and braking techniques. While confidence and skill will grow, so too must the realisation that the safety of others is becoming increasingly dependent upon our actions and attitudes.

results.title: Intellectual growth and achievement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
Parents and teachers are ambitious for their children to become good students. Questions about how to develop intellectual growth and achievement have been the focus of many psychological studies. Examines myths such as predicting later ability on early achievement in childhood and the importance of hands on activity as opposed to observation. Factors determining IQ, using twins and adoptees raise interesting questions regarding the nature versus nurture debate, as well as looking at factors during pregnancy which may affect intellectual development.
results.description:

results.title: Driving to a system
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “How to Drive”.
The drills of the system of car control demonstrated have been well tried and are well proven; once memorised and understood, the system soon becomes an almost instinctive routine. The system is designed to ensure that at all times the car is in the right place on the road, travelling at the right speed for existing conditions, in the right gear, and the driver is never trying to do more than one thing at a time.
